text:
Hi Yaw, The first job I had in a bigger VFX house was at MPC in London. I had not applied for the job, but was lucky to be contacted by them. They had seen my profile and they liked my background, skillset and showreel. So they got in touch and asked me to come in for an interview and I was hired.

A good showreel is very important. (Short and only your best work). And to keep your social media profiles (like LinkedIn) updated.
But sometimes itâ€™s just luck. It happened to me quite a few times; I did not apply for the job but a recruiters reaches out because they are in need of people.

Other ways to enter the industry is as a runner and work your way up, or apply for an apprenticeships. Most of the bigger VFX studios have apprenticeships programs. But often you have to do it within a year after you graduated.
